entry.title: across的常见用法
entry.content:
1、preposition

a、from one side to the other side of (something) 从一边到另一边
  • We took a ferry across the river
b、on the other side of 在…对面
  • He was seated across the table from me.
c、so as to reach or spread over or throughout (something)穿过；越过
  • Looking out across the ocean, he saw land.
  • throught

2、adverb

a、同介词
  • The streams are small enough to jump across.

b、宽

  • At its widest point, the pond measures 150 feet across.

c、在对面

  • I saw them crossing the street and I waited until they were safely across.

entry.title: 形近词
entry.content:
第一组

  • pertinent 相关的

  • pertinacious

  • tenacious

  • impertinent 粗鲁的

第二组

  • macerate 浸泡(使柔软)
  • maculate 玷污 破坏
  • emaciate 削弱

第三组

  • tractable
  • tactful
  • tactile

第四组

  • penacea 万能药、万灵药
  • penance 忏悔

第五组

  • convivial
  • vivacious

第六组

  • cardinal
  • cordial

第七组

  • resonant 回响的、共鸣的、声音洪亮的
  • consonant 一致的

第八组

  • govern 管理 统治 支配 控制
  • government 政府、管理、政体
  • governor 统治者 管理者 州长
  • minister 牧师大臣
  • administer 管理、执行、实施
  • ministry
  • administrate 管理 支配
  • administration 管理 行政 政府
  • administrator 管理人员 行政人员

第九组

  • precede 先于、领先、优于

  • preceding 在先的、在前的

  • precedent 先例、前例 在前的

  • precedence 优先级 ≈ priority

  • proceed 前进 继续 开始 发生

  • proceeding 行动 进程

entry.title: 同义词
entry.content:
第一组

晦涩难懂的 难以理解的 深奥的

  • cryptic(有隐含义的)
  • opaque
  • elusive
  • esoteric 不外传的

  • impenetrable

entry.title: charge用法
entry.content:
1、verb

a、充电
  • charge a car’s battery
b、be charged with ≈ be responsible for 负责
  • The board was charged with deciding where to build a new school.\
c、to formally accuse (someone) of a crime 指控；控告 ；指责
  • They charged him with theft
  • She was charged with murder.
d、收费
  • The shop charged $100 for repairs.
  • They charge a fee for late payment.

2、noun

a、管理
  • in charge of
  • take charge of ≈ take control of
b、收费
  • There is no charge for fixing the tire.
c、控告
  • They dropped the charges against him.
